sen.j: 『花園天皇宸記』正和2年（1313)10月14日条に「今日寛平御記十巻、一見了」と記されていることから、当時10巻が伝存していたことがわかるが、現在は1巻も残存していない。
sen.e: Although the fact that the diary of October 14, 1313 of "Hanazono Tenno Shinki (The Records of Emperor Hanazono)" described "Today, I finished to read the tenth volume of Kanpyo gyoki" shows that Kanpyo gyoki existed in 10 volumes, no book exists now.

sen.j: また、『西宮記』『扶桑略記』等の逸文から、宇多天皇践祚当日の仁和3年（887年)8月26日から譲位した寛平9年（897年）7月3日までの10年間に50余条が確認される。
sen.e: Also, the existence of more than 50 diaries in 10 years from August 26, 887 when the Emperor Uda to July 3, 897 were confirmed in itsubun (a composition previously existed but doesn't exist now) such as "Seikyuki" and "Fuso Ryakki (A Brief History of Japan)."

Also, the existence of more than 50 diaries in 10 years from August 26, 887 when the Emperor Uda to July 3, 897 were confirmed in itsubun (a composition previously existing but no longer remains) such as "Seikyuki" and "Fuso Ryakki (A Brief History of Japan)."

Also, the existence of more than 50 diaries in 10 years from September 21, 887 when the Emperor Uda to August 8, 897 were confirmed in itsubun (a composition previously existing but no longer remains) such as "Saikyuki" (record of court practices and usage, written by MINAMOTO no Takaaki) and "Fuso Ryakki (A Brief History of Japan)."
